definition: to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
"vertical stroke with hook" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 6)/see also 豎鉤|竖钩[shu4 gou1]
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to work hard for/to do all one can/to contend strongly
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...

sentences.english: The two boys vied with each other for the first place.
sentences.chinese: 那兩個男孩子爭第一名。

sentences.english: Hypocrisy is also at play in how Bernanke and his Chinese counterparts are embroiled in a race to the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 伯南克與其中國對手的競次之爭不也是一種虛僞麼。

sentences.english: What he does redounds to the credit of our motherland.
sentences.chinese: 他做的事爲祖國爭了光。

sentences.english: He did much credit to his patrons.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的恩人爭了很多面子。

sentences.english: Fireflies fly everywhere on summer nights, which attract children to chase after them.
sentences.chinese: 夏日的夜晚，流螢飛舞，惹得孩子們爭着抓撲。

sentences.english: We're made to feel special and desired and important.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓我們覺得自己很特別，很重要，家家爭。

sentences.english: The next day investors queued up to buy Freddie's bonds.
sentences.chinese: 翌日，投資人排起長龍，爭購房地美的債券。

sentences.english: Not before and not after. It's been this way for 15 years.
sentences.chinese: 不早於，不晚於，就這樣爭了15年。

sentences.english: But it may be racing China for the silver medal.
sentences.chinese: 但它可能要和中國爭銀牌了。

sentences.english: I would argue that it does, but I would never get anywhere with that.
sentences.chinese: 我想要同她爭辯說有，但卻從來也說不出個所以然。

sentences.english: Two guys tried to beat each other's time around the woman.
sentences.chinese: 有兩個傢伙圍繞着這個女人競相角逐，爭風喫醋。

sentences.english: We rejected their conditions for settling the border dispute.
sentences.chinese: 我們拒絕了他們對解決邊界爭爭端出的條件。

sentences.english: Don't fight with the world, again good only vanity, silently at.
sentences.chinese: 不要與世相爭，再好也只不過是虛榮，要靜靜逍遙。

sentences.english: At a round table there's no dispute of place.
He did much credit to his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他爲他的父母爭了很多面子。

definition: to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
to lean against/to rely on/on the basis of/no matter (how, what etc)/proof
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
